intro: Canthium travancoricum, commonly known as the Travancore canthium, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
